glsa.title: Oops!: Remote code execution
glsa.synopsis: The Oops! proxy server contains a remotely exploitable format string vulnerability, which could potentially lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Oops! is an advanced, multithreaded caching web proxy.

description.p: A format string flaw has been detected in the my_xlog() function of the Oops! proxy, which is called by the passwd_mysql and passwd_pgsql module's auth() functions.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted HTTP request to the Oops! proxy, potentially triggering this vulnerability and leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Oops! users should upgrade to the latest version:
